newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Manila sees local oil prices rising in January.
newsitem.headline: Manila sees local oil prices rising in January.

text.p: The Philippines' Energy Regulatory Board (ERB) said on Monday it may raise prices for all oil products this month as a result of increasing prices of petroleum products in Singapore.

ERB chairman Bayani Faylona told Reuters by telephone that initial computations by the board showed liquefied petroleum gasoline (LPG) may require the biggest increase of 88 centavos per litre followed by jet fuel at 38 centavos and kerosene at 33 centavos.

Faylona said based on Singapore Posted Prices (SPP) from December 13 to 31, other upward adjustments include the following: 32.5 centavos per litre rise for diesel, 25 centavos for fuel oil, 21 centavos for regular gasoline, 16 centavos for unleaded premium gasoline and 15 centavos for premium gasoline.
"Our prognosis, so far, is that all prices will go up. The severe winter in Europe has trigerred increases in the price of crude in the world market," said Faylona.
He said the ERB will take into account movements in SPPs from January 1 to shortly before the third Monday or January 20 before finalising the adjustments.
The oil deregulation law allows the ERB to adjusts pump prices on or before the third Monday of every month using movements in SPPs as the benchmark.
Any price increase in excess of 50 centavos per litre is automatically passed on to the Oil Price Stabilisation Fund (OPSF).
